title: Boston African American National Historic Site: Management
body: Management       Boston African American National Historic Site works in partnership with the Museum of African American History, the City of Boston, and private property owners to promote, preserve, and interpret the history of Boston's free African American community on Beacon Hill in the 1800s. It includes the homes, businesses, schools, and churches of a community that struggled against the forces of slavery and injustice. Management Documents: Superintendent's Compendium
